content.question: Which of the following describes one way that African Americans’ freedom was impacted immediately following their emancipation?

choices.label: Congress passed laws that slowed the process of granting citizenship to formerly enslaved people.
Local governments enacted laws that forced formerly enslaved people to enter into labor contracts for little pay.
Congress established the Freedmen’s Bureau to keep track of formerly enslaved people.
Federal law overturned state slave codes that limited the movement of African Americans throughout the South.

content.answer: Local governments enacted laws that forced formerly enslaved people to enter into labor contracts for little pay.
